page.title: 09Compton Castle, Near Marldon
page.content: Compton Castle is a fortified manor house, which was built in 3 periods, 1349, 1450 and 1520, by the Gilbert family. Sir Humphrey Gilbert was an explorer who founded the colony of Newfoundland. His half brother was Sir Walter Raleigh. The Castle was allowed to fall into a ruin, but Commander Gilbert saw it when he was in the Navy at Dartmouth and he decided to make it the Gilbert family home again. The Castle is now owned by the National Trust and is open on Mondays, Wednesdays and Thursdays. It is now lived in by Mr.G. E.Gilbert who is Commander Gilbert's son. Lots of people come to visit the Castle. It is used quite often for plays and for very special local events. You can see the Great Hall, the solar, the chapel and the old kitchen.
